com.ebay.redlasersdk.uicomponents
Class RotatedImageView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.widget.ImageView
          com.ebay.redlasersdk.uicomponents.RotatedImageView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
public class RotatedImageView
extends android.widget.ImageView

If your application wishes to do scanning on API level 7 devices, and you want to use Portrait orientation, you should use the classes in this package to set up a special view hierarchy.

Before API level 8, Android only supported landscape mode for the camera. Portrait orientation on API level 7 can be faked by using these utility classes to present UI elements that are rotated 90 degrees. That is, RotatedButton, RotatedImageView, and RotatedTextView are UI widgets that appear in portrait mode when placed in a landscape layout.
